javadoc:
Class to describe the connection between two tools for a specific event.
 This class is used by the ToolSetImpl when it serializes itself.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: producerName
params.comment: name of the tool the produces the event

params.name: consumerName
params.comment: name of the tool that consumes the event

params.name: event
params.comment:
name of the event that represents the connection
 between the tools

methods.javadoc: Get the event that connects the tools.
methods.name: getEvent
methods.comment: Get the event that connects the tools.

methods.javadoc: Returns a hash code value for the object. This method is supported for the benefit of hashtables such as those provided by java.util.Hashtable.

methods.comment:
Returns a hash code value for the object. This method is

methods.javadoc: Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.
methods.name: equals
methods.comment: Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.

methods.javadoc: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read.

methods.comment:
